member.name: M:TextObjectModel.TextDocument.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Increments the freeze count. If the freeze count is nonzero, screen updating is disabled.
member.remarks: Disabling screen updating will reduce flicker when performing several consecutive operations on a range.

Whether to enable advanced typography options in the control.
member.returns: instance representing the rich text document in the control.

This method binds the to the lifetime of the control. All resources used by the object will be released when the control is disposed.

member.name: T:TextObjectModel.TextDocument
member.summary: Represents a top-level document in the Text Object Model (TOM).

remarks.para: Managed wrapper class for the COM interface ITextDocument. ITextDocument interface
You can obtain an instance in a number of ways:

item.description: From an instance of the Windows Forms control (using the method). This is the preferred method.

From a native RichEdit control (by passing its window handle to the method). Use this method if you need to use a specific or custom version of the RichEdit control that you have instantiated yourself.
From a Runtime Callable Wrapper (RCW) for a COM object that implements the ITextDocument interface (see method).
From an unmanaged pointer to the IUnknown interface of a COM object that implements ITextDocument (see method).

member.summary: Creates a by loading a specific version of the native RichEdit control from the specified DLL.
member.param: The path to the DLL that contains the RichEdit control.
The name of the window class used to create the control.
member.returns: The control.
member.exception: The DLL at the path pointed to by does not exist, could not be loaded or has the wrong processor architecture.

member.name: M:TextObjectModel.RichTextBoxEx.#cctor
member.summary: Type initializer.

member.name: T:TextObjectModel.RichTextBoxEx
member.summary: Extends to allow the underlying RichEdit control to be loaded from either the shared Microsoft Office DLL or the Windows MSFTEDIT.DLL library.

remarks.para: During its initial creation, the control will attempt to locate a Microsoft Office shared DLL containing the desired RichEdit control. If this fails (either because Office is not installed or the DLL is for a different processor architecture), it will try MSFTEDIT.DLL instead.

In order to utilise the Microsoft Office implementation, the caller must have read access for following registry key: HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\SharedDLLs - this may not be available in sandboxed environments.

Important: The processor architecture of the Microsoft Office installation must match that of the calling process. If both the 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Office are installed, the control will attempt both DLLs until it finds a suitable match.

After loading the libraries into memory, it will then select the highest version of the RichEdit control that is available. It will select from the following window class names (in order of preference):

summary.para: Contains managed wrapper classes for Microsoft's Text Object Model (TOM) interfaces (e.g. ITextDocument, ITextRange, etc).

The top-level object in this implementation is the class. The most common usage scenario is to create an instance from a control. This library also includes the control, which provides access to advanced RichEdit functionality.
For more information, refer to the Text Object Model documentation or visit the TOM Classes for .NET project page. Text Object Model (Windows)TOM Classes for .NET

member.name: M:TextObjectModel.TextRange.FindTextStart(System.String,System.Int32,TextObjectModel.RangeMatchType)
member.summary: Searches up to characters for , starting at the range's start.
member.param: String to find.
Maximum number of characters to search.
Flags governing comparisons.
member.returns: The length of string matched.
member.remarks: The search is subject to the comparison parameter, . If the string is found, the start is changed to be the matched string, and the length of the string is returned. If the string is not found, the range is unchanged and zero is returned.

member.name: M:TextObjectModel.TextRange.FindTextStart(System.String,TextObjectModel.RangeMatchType)

member.returns: The length of string matched.

member.returns: The length of string matched.
member.remarks: The search is subject to the comparison parameter, . If the string is found, the end is changed to be the end of the matched string, and the length of the string is returned. If the string is not found, the range is unchanged and zero is returned.

member.name: T:TextObjectModel.TextRange
member.summary: Represents a range of text in a document in the Text Object Model (TOM).

remarks.para: Managed wrapper class for the COM interface ITextRange. ITextRange interface

Ranges are the primary mechanism for reading and manipulating text in TOM. A range provides access to the content and formatting options for the rich text bounded by a particular start and end position.
A range can be obtained by:

item.description: Using the TextDocument.EntireRange property, to get a range that spans the entire document
Requesting a range with a particular start and end position via the TextDocument.Range(Int32,Int32) method
Creating a duplicate of an existing range (using the method), which can then be moved/resized independently

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextPara.ListTypeInternal
member.summary: Gets or sets the kind of numbering to use with paragraphs.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextPara.ComObject
member.summary: Gets a pointer to the underlying COM object.

member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The ITextPara to wrap.

member.name: M:TextObjectModel.TextPara.GetHashCode
member.summary: Calculates a hash code for this object.
member.returns: A hash code for this object.

member.name: M:TextObjectModel.TextPara.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Tests if this is considered equal to another object.

member.returns: true if the objects are considered equal, false if they are not.

member.name: M:TextObjectModel.TextPara.Equals(TextObjectModel.TextPara)
member.summary: Tests if this is considered equal to another.
member.param: The to compare to this object.
member.returns: true if the objects are considered equal, false if they are not.

member.name: M:TextObjectModel.TextPara.CopyFrom(TextObjectModel.TextPara)
member.summary: Sets the paragraph formatting by copying another paragraph object.
member.param: The paragraph object to apply to this paragraph object.

member.name: M:TextObjectModel.TextPara.Reset
member.summary: Resets the paragraph formatting to the default values.

member.name: M:TextObjectModel.TextPara.SetIndents(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the first-line indent, the left indent, and the right indent for a paragraph.
member.param: Indent of the first line in a paragraph, relative to the left indent. The value is in floating-point points and can be positive or negative.
Left indent of all lines except the first line in a paragraph, relative to left margin. The value is in floating-point points and can be positive or negative.
Right indent of all lines in paragraph, relative to the right margin. The value is in floating-point points and can be positive or negative. This value is optional.

member.name: M:TextObjectModel.TextPara.GetTab(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves tab displacement for the specified tab.
member.param: Index of tab for which to retrieve info.
member.returns: The tab displacement, in floating-point points.

member.name: M:TextObjectModel.TextPara.GetTab(TextObjectModel.TabRelativePosition,System.Single)
member.summary: Retrieves tab displacement for the specified tab.
member.param: Indicates which tab to retrieve relative to .
The tab displacement, in floating-point points.
member.returns: The tab displacement, in floating-point points.

member.name: M:TextObjectModel.TextPara.DeleteTab(System.Single)
member.summary: Deletes a tab at a specified displacement.
member.param: Displacement, in floating-point points, at which a tab should be deleted.

member.name: M:TextObjectModel.TextPara.ClearAllTabs
member.summary: Clears all tabs, reverting to equally spaced tabs with the default tab spacing.

member.name: M:TextObjectModel.TextPara.AddTab(System.Single)
member.summary: Adds a tab at the displacement .
member.param: New tab displacement, in floating-point points.

member.name: M:TextObjectModel.TextPara.Clone
member.summary: Creates a duplicate of the specified paragraph format object.
member.returns: The duplicate text paragraph object.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextPara.TabCount
member.summary: Retrieves the tab count.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextPara.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets the style handle to the paragraphs in the specified range.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextPara.SpaceBefore
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of vertical space above a paragraph.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextPara.SpaceAfter
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of vertical space below a paragraph.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextPara.RightIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the right margin indent of a paragraph.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextPara.ListBulletChar
member.summary: Gets or sets the Unicode character (>32) to use for bullets.
member.exception: has a character code of 32 or lower.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextPara.ListNumberingFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format to use with a numbered list.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextPara.ListType
member.summary: Gets or sets the kind of numbering to use with paragraphs.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextPara.ListTab
member.summary: Retrieves the list tab setting, which is the distance between the first-line indent and the text on the first line. The numbered or bulleted text is left-justified, centered, or right-justified at the first-line indent value.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextPara.ListStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the starting value or code of a list numbering sequence.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextPara.ListLevelIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the list level index used with paragraphs.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextPara.ListAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the kind of alignment to use for bulleted and numbered lists.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextPara.LeftIndent
member.summary: Gets the distance used to indent all lines except the first line of a paragraph. The distance is relative to the left margin.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextPara.Hyphenation
member.summary: Gets or sets the current paragraph alignment value.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextPara.FirstLineIndent
member.summary: Gets the amount used to indent the first line of a paragraph relative to the left indent. The left indent is the indent for all lines of the paragraph except the first line.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextPara.CanChange
member.summary: Determines whether the paragraph formatting can be changed.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextPara.Alignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the current paragraph alignment value.

member.name: T:TextObjectModel.TextPara
member.summary: Provides access to the paragraph format for a text range.

remarks.para: Managed wrapper class for the COM interface ITextPara. ITextPara interface
Most properties of this class are implemented using nullable types. If a property returns null, its value is undefined. Properties may be undefined if the range spans several paragraph formats.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextFont.Weight
member.summary: Gets or sets the font weight for the characters in a range.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextFont.UnderlineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the underline color for the characters in a range.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextFont.UnderlineStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of underlining for the characters in a range.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextFont.Superscript
member.summary: Gets or sets whether characters are displayed as superscript.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextFont.Subscript
member.summary: Gets or sets whether characters are displayed as subscript.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextFont.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets the character style handle of the characters in a range.

remarks.para: The Text Object Model (TOM) version 1.0 does not specify the meanings of the style handles. The meanings depend on other facilities of the text system that implements TOM.
This implementation uses the low byte to store information about colored underlining. The higher 3 bytes are preserved and can be used for your own purposes.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextFont.StrikeThrough
member.summary: Gets or sets whether characters are displayed with a horizontal line through the center.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextFont.SmallCaps
member.summary: Gets or sets whether characters are in small capital letters.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextFont.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the font size, in points.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextFont.Shadow
member.summary: Gets or sets whether characters are displayed as shadowed characters.

member.name: P:TextObjectModel.TextFont.Protected
member.summary: Gets or sets whether characters are protected against attempts to modify them.

member.name: T:TextObjectModel.RangeInsertMode
member.summary: Options for inserting text into a range.

member.name: F:TextObjectModel.RangeInsertMode.Expand
member.summary: Expand the range to include the inserted text.

member.summary: Options for appending text to a range.

member.summary: Preserve the original character positions of the range.

member.name: F:TextObjectModel.RangeAppendMode.Expand
member.summary: Expand the range to include the new text.

member.name: F:TextObjectModel.RangeAppendMode.Collapse
member.summary: Collapse the range to its new end.

member.name: F:TextObjectModel.TextOpenSave.OpenAlways
member.summary: Open an existing file. Create a new file if the file does not exist.

member.name: F:TextObjectModel.TextOpenSave.OpenExisting
member.summary: Open an existing file. Fail if the file does not exist.

member.name: F:TextObjectModel.TextOpenSave.CreateAlways
member.summary: Create a new file. Destroy the existing file if it exists.

member.name: F:TextObjectModel.TextOpenSave.CreateNew
member.summary: Create a new file. Fail if the file already exists.

member.name: F:TextObjectModel.TextOpenSave.Default
member.summary: Gives read/write access and read/write sharing, open always, and automatic recognition of the file format (unrecognized file formats are treated as text).
